review_blob: Super fresh hop nose, like a bag of whole hops. Citrusy, slight white pepper. Mouthfeel is medium, balanced and clean. Lots of fresh citrus on the palate, herbaceous notes, including lemongrass. A lot of really cool fresh herb notes, such as basil, etc., followed by a pleasantly weighty and viscous finish.

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Nice full, meaty nose, with some tar and ruby port like aromas. Bright sweetness on the front of the palate, which morphs into a warm, toffee, coffee laced mid and back palate. Great creamy texture matched by a great bit of bitterness to round it out. Really nice.

Deep black with medium tan head. Coffee and chocolate notes on the nose. Slight herbaceous aroma, brambly. Palate is creamy, full, but pleasantly crisp on the finish. Great as a warmer, but not cloying. Toffee, cocoa and hazelnut flavors, with vanilla and a subtle caramel note. Definite nutty bitterness on the finish, great lengthy finish. Beautifully restrained yet complex!

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Great clarity. Amber color. Nose is super rich and malty. A slight bit of tropical fruit, as well as a soft white pepper. The palate has a bright intensity of fruit on top of the malty rich base. It dries out mid palate, leaving an almost refreshing dry finish.

beer_brewer_name: Pretty Things Beer and Ale Project
review_blob: Color is a honey-gold hue. Nose is subtle, laden with spicy ginger, and a touch of banana. Subtle toasty notes as well. Mouthfeel is gorgeous, with a surprisingly rich and creamy body. It drops off a bit sooner than I would like however. Gingerbread, clove and a bit of spice on the palate, with a nice dry finish. Though the creamy body tapers off early, the flavors linger substantially longer.

Had on draft at Thirsty Monk in Asheville. Pretty intense aromatics, nutty notes, bright and fresh. The body is fairly light, not to say it is lacking in flavor. or intensity. Very crisp, bitter, extremely dry style. Finish leaves a bit to be desired, drops off rather quickly. Pleasant, though a bit pricy. ($7.50)

Extremely volcanic carbonation. The nose didnt give up a whole lot at first, but after a minute, a honeycomb, slightly nutty earthy aroma came through. The color is a lovely golden amber, and the cream colored foam was peppered with cinnamon colored flecks, really very pretty. On the palate, the first impression is of crystallized ginger, dry, and with honeyed overtones. For 10% alcohol, the body is not as weighty as I would expect. The finish is very dry, with the slightlest bit of white pepper on the finish. Really gorgeous stuff.
